question: Some people believe that to be successful in a sport, natural ability is necessary while others think hard work and practice is more important. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
text: It is thought by some that having an instinctive competency is essential  in order to prosper in sports, others, however, believe that strong effort and constant rehearsal are highly of great importance.  In my opinion,  I consider that consistency in practice is the best way to achieve greater heights in sporting.

On the one hand,  some people have suggested that the natural effort of an athlete is what makes him successful.  This is as a result of the skills they are being born with, and right from their childhood, they display attributes of being a great athlete in the future. These young ones are being nurtured at an early stage and they master the skills when they become adults. To illustrate,  Kanu Nwankwo of Nigeria super eagles team started playing football at the age of 5, and since then till his adulthood,  he has obviously shown the world the skills in perfection in his career as a footballer.

On the other hand, others are of the opinion that constant practical sessions and hard work  is of great importance to the success in sports and I agree. Firstly,  when an athlete  has a professional trainer that motivates him all the time, he definitely will not lose focus and also,  he tends to work much harder to get to the level he aspires to. This is because,  in order  to achieve  your goals  in I  life, you must be consistent in your task.  For example,  Mohammed Ali,  the world number one heavyweight champion in boxing, once said that it was only his consistent effort in  his eight hours per day training that made him reach the level he is now. More so, this has indicated that the important role of constant rehearsal cannot be compromised.
In conclusion, while people may vary in their opinion, I believe that consistency and progressive obligations are essential if you want to achieve success in any sporting activity.
